content:
Hey,
In the last 15 hours the user paulajaime2703 opened 7 spam issues with no content.
I have no idea how you would handle cases like this.
I just wanted to inform you here.

here are the issues

github staffs once said they're happy to ban users like this. So infra devs could report them.
Or at least block them out of rust-lang organization.
I thought anyone could flag things
I can open a report and see what happens
We can email rust-mods@rust-lang.org for help with it.
I have also, which probably helps to have multiple.
I'm not worried about our mods yet.
Github will probably do a better job.
I could be wrong, but this particular user seems to just not know how to use GitHub rather than being actively malicious.
Perhaps, but they haven't communicated yet.
Over 15 hours
I told them to stop, but they don't explain or ask for help: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/77053#issuecomment-696724831
We can just report and see what Github does, otherwise, someone can block him from the org
And if you look at their user profile they have not done anything else.
I can block them, but that's the kind of thing I would wait until something more malicious happens, and would definitely involve the mods with.

Eh2406 said:

And if you look at their user profile they have not done anything else.

Done anything public, at least.

This is actually what makes me think that it's a bot or something. Your only interaction on GitHub is opening a bunch of duplicate issues?
But if anyone wants to do their homework: https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=be73c9c6ff67f18da4848292749da82a
Looks like some automated tool gone bad, or testing some bot.
then just report it for github handle.
One thing that's interesting is that they used the rarely-used "put this playground as a github issue" feature
... and they try to use a malformed C++ program in the rust playground ? Really strange.
I have to correct myself, this looks like a new student thinking play.rust is some form of C++ editor or similar which has poor english skills and therefore doesn't notice the problem.
Amusingly, that's how I started learning Rust. I literally renamed a foo.cxx file to foo.rs and ran rustc foo.rs and edited until it compiled.

Jake Goulding said:

One thing that's interesting is that they used the rarely-used "put this playground as a github issue" feature

Oh wow, didn't know this was a thing. Are people using this? (for real reports, I mean)
I have used it several times.

Jake Goulding said:

I can block them

I take this back. GitHub was telling me I can block them personally, but not for rust-lang. I'm rather relieved I don't have the ability to do that, in fact.
If you block someone personally, they will be blocked from all organizations you are an owner of
i don't think there's enough justify them being a bot, i guess we can just delete the issues and move on
It looks like they deleted their account or GitHub banned them because they don't have a user page anymore.
that code looks like it was literally a homework assignment.

Jake Goulding said:

One thing that's interesting is that they used the rarely-used "put this playground as a github issue" feature

I had no idea this feature even existed^^
